item.title: 澳大利亚财政部葡萄酒公司利润增长，但财政部高端品牌业务疲软
item.description: 周四，澳大利亚财政部葡萄酒公司（Treasury Wine Estates）公布上半年利润增长近33%，原因是其奢侈品牌奔富（Penfolds）的增长和DAOU葡萄园的贡献增加，但部分增长被财政部高端品牌（Treasury Premium Brands）的疲软所抵消。【原文：Australia's Treasury Wine Estates posted nearly a 33% rise in first-half profit on Thursday, on growth in its luxury label Penfolds and higher contribution from DAOU vineyards, partly offset by weakness in Treasury Premium Brands.】

item.title: 合并谈判陷入僵局后，日产和本田将更新双方关系
item.description: 预计日产和本田将于周四就其不确定的关系展开新一轮谈判，在两家日本汽车制造商的谈判破裂后，它们很可能会正式取消合并计划。【原文：Nissan and Honda are expected to lay out a new stage in their uncertain relationship on Thursday, one that is likely to see them formally call off a plan to merge after talks between the two Japanese automakers foundered.】

item.title: 信中称，美国司法部将停止维护联邦贸易委员会和全国劳资关系委员会的独立性
item.description: 据一位民主党国会议员周三发布的一封信称，美国司法部将停止维护三个消费者和工人保护机构的独立地位。【原文：The U.S. Department of Justice will cease defending the independent status of three consumer and worker protection agencies, according to a letter posted by a Democratic member of Congress on Wednesday.】

item.title: 工会起诉特朗普，担心大规模解雇联邦雇员
item.description: 五个工会周三起诉特朗普政府，要求阻止他们所谓的可能大规模解雇数十万名顶住压力接受买断的联邦雇员的行为。【原文：Five unions sued the Trump administration on Wednesday, seeking to block what they called the possible mass firing of hundreds of thousands of federal employees who resist pressure to accept buyouts.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，马斯克的 X 公司同意支付约 1,000 万美元和解特朗普诉讼案
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体平台 X 同意支付约 1000 万美元，以解决美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对该公司及其前首席执行官提起的诉讼。【原文：Elon Musk's social media platform X has agreed to pay about $10 million to settle a lawsuit that U.S. President Donald Trump brought against the company and its former chief executive, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 由于美元走强的影响，Equinix 预测季度和全年收入低于预期
item.description: Equinix 周三预测第一季度和全年营收低于预期，受美元走强的影响，人们对企业加倍努力采用生成式人工智能而在数据中心扩建方面投入巨资的担忧加剧。【原文：Equinix forecast first-quarter and annual revenue below estimates on Wednesday, hurt by a strong dollar amid rising concerns about hefty spending on data center expansion as businesses double down on generative AI adoption.】

item.title: 巴拿马船舶注册处称其 "不是逃避制裁的避风港
item.description: 中美洲国家巴拿马海事局周三表示，巴拿马已经取得进展，将不符合巴拿马国旗标准的船只从其注册表中剔除，以回应美国对巴拿马允许受制裁国家移动悬挂巴拿马国旗船只的批评。【原文：Panama has made progress stripping vessels from its registry that do not meet its flag's standards, the Central American nation's Maritime Authority said on Wednesday, responding to U.S. criticism that it allowed sanctioned countries to move ships with the Panamanian flag.】

item.title: 米高梅股价大涨，季度利润和收入均超预期
item.description: 赌场运营商米高梅国际酒店集团（MGM Resorts International）周三公布的第四季度利润和收入均超出预期，主要得益于旗下各酒店预订量增加。【原文：Casino operator MGM Resorts International beat fourth-quarter profit and revenue estimates on Wednesday, aided by strength from more bookings across its properties.】

item.title: 早间竞价乌克兰停火希望缓解美国通胀打击
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 削减成本抵消锂价格下跌影响，Albemarle 实现季度盈利
item.description: 全球最大的锂生产商阿尔伯马尔公司（Albemarle）周三表示，由于成本削减帮助抵消了用于制造电动汽车电池的金属价格的暴跌，该公司实现了季度盈利。【原文：Albemarle , the world's largest producer of lithium, said on Wednesday it swung to a quarterly profit as cost cuts helped offset plunging prices for the metal used to make electric vehicle batteries.】

item.title: 特朗普表示将于周三签署互惠关税令
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）表示，他将于周三签署一项命令，对所有向美国进口商品征收关税的国家征收对等关税。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said he will sign an order on Wednesday to impose reciprocal tariffs on every country that charges duties on U.S. imports.】

item.title: Reddit 预计季度营收高于预期
item.description: Reddit 周三预计，第一季度营收将高于华尔街预期，这主要得益于其人工智能内容授权交易和强劲的数字广告支出。【原文：Reddit forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Wednesday, betting on its artificial intelligence content licensing deals and a robust digital advertising spend.】

item.title: 思科上调全年收入预期
item.description: 思科系统公司（Cisco Systems）周三上调了年度营收预期，押注在人工智能技术蓬勃发展的背景下对其云网络设备的需求增加，从而使其股价在延时交易中上涨了 6.7%。【原文：Cisco Systems raised its annual revenue forecast on Wednesday, betting on higher demand for its cloud networking gear amid a boom in the artificial intelligence technology, sending its shares up 6.7% in extended trading.】

item.title: 大选后交易狂潮提升交易量，Robinhood 盈利创历史新高
item.description: 交易平台 Robinhood 周三公布，在唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）赢得总统大选后，股票和加密货币市场的疯狂活动推动下，第四季度利润激增。【原文：Trading platform Robinhood reported a surge in fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, fueled by frenetic activity in equity and crypto markets following Donald Trump's presidential election victory.】

item.title: 首席执行官 Altman 表示，OpenAI 计划在最新模型的新路线图中简化人工智能产品
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）周三表示，OpenAI 将不会把 "o3 "作为独立的人工智能模型发布，因为这家 ChatGPT 制造商希望简化其产品。【原文：OpenAI will not release "o3" as a standalone artificial intelligence model, as the ChatGPT maker looks to simplify its products, CEO Sam Altman said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔认为美联储缩减持股还有待时日
item.description: 本周，美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在国会发表了为期两天的证词，表示央行的资产负债表缩减进程并没有马上结束，因为一些银行已经采取行动，将它们自己的量化紧缩进程结束日期推后。【原文：Over two days of testimony this week before Congress, Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell indicated there's no imminent end to the central bank's balance sheet wind down process, as some banks have moved to push back their own end date for a process commonly referred to as quantitative tightening.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，德国巴斯夫考虑将农用化学品部门在美国或德国上市
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周三报道，德国顶级化工制造商巴斯夫公司（BASF SE）已要求银行为其农用化学品部门的潜在上市进行投标，上市地点可能在美国或德国。【原文：Germany's top chemical maker BASF SE has asked banks to pitch for a potential listing of its agricultural chemicals division, possibly in the United States or Germany, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 削减登月火箭将考验马斯克在共和党州裁员的能力
item.description: 熟悉讨论情况的消息人士称，唐纳德-特朗普总统正被敦促砍掉一个预算过高、耗资数十亿美元的登月火箭项目，这将引发一场与共和党议员的激烈斗争，而共和党议员的选区依赖于该项目带来的就业机会。【原文：President Donald Trump is being urged to axe an over-budget, multi-billion dollar moon rocket, sources familiar with the discussions said, setting up a titanic struggle with Republican lawmakers whose districts depend on the program's jobs.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司到 2030 年将在巴西投资约 35 亿美元
item.description: 巴西飞机制造商巴西航空工业公司首席执行官弗朗西斯科-戈梅斯-内托（Francisco Gomes Neto）周三表示，该公司计划到2030年在巴西投资200亿雷亚尔（约合34.7亿美元）。【原文：Brazilian planemaker Embraer plans to invest 20 billion reais ($3.47 billion) in the country by 2030, Chief Executive Francisco Gomes Neto said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 巴西政府称淡水河谷将宣布在巴西卡拉哈斯投资 120 亿美元
item.description: 巴西总统府周三表示，巴西矿业公司淡水河谷将于周五宣布投资 700 亿雷亚尔（122 亿美元），以扩大其在巴西北部卡拉哈斯地区的铁矿石和铜矿开采业务。【原文：Brazilian miner Vale will announce on Friday a 70 billion reais ($12.2 billion) investment to expand its iron ore and copper mining operations in the Carajas complex in northern Brazil, the presidential palace said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 马里兰州和巴尔的摩市以暴力威胁为由，就易改装枪支起诉格洛克公司
item.description: 马里兰州和巴尔的摩市周三起诉格洛克公司，要求迫使该国最大的枪支销售商之一采取措施，防止枪主将其产品改装成类似机关枪的自动武器。【原文：Maryland and the city of Baltimore sued Glock on Wednesday, seeking to force one of the country's largest gun sellers to take steps to prevent owners from modifying its products into automatic weapons resembling machine guns.】

item.title: 由于日历变动和支出增加，美国 1 月份出现 1,290 亿美元的赤字
item.description: 美国财政部周三表示，联邦政府一月份的预算赤字为 1290 亿美元，与 2024 年 1 月异常低的 220 亿美元赤字相比大幅增加，原因是福利支付的日历变动以及社会保障、医疗保险、利息和其他项目的支出增长快于收入增长。【原文：The federal government posted a $129 billion budget deficit for January, up sharply from an unusually low $22 billion deficit in January 2024 due to calendar shifts in benefit payments as well as outlays for Social Security, Medicare, interest and other items that grew faster than receipts, the U.S. Treasury said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国 2024 年第四季度盈利增长将创三年来最高水平
item.description: 根据伦敦证券交易所集团（LSEG）的数据，由于通信服务、金融和其他行业的业绩远超预期，2024 年第四季度 S&P 500 指数的盈利增长有望达到 2021 年底以来的最高水平。【原文：S&P 500 earnings growth for the fourth quarter of 2024 is on track to be the highest since the end of 2021, according to LSEG, thanks to much stronger-than-expected results in communication services, financials and other sectors.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国国际开发署（USAID）经费削减导致美国大学的农业研究停滞不前
item.description: 据六位实验室主任称，特朗普政府解散美国国际开发署后，13 个州的土地赠予大学农业研究实验室网络的工作已经停止。【原文：The Trump administration's dismantling of the U.S. Agency for International Development has halted work at a network of farm research laboratories at land grant universities in 13 states, according to six lab directors.】

item.title: 一月通胀升温令市场震荡，降息希望渺茫
item.description: 美国 1 月份出人意料的强劲通胀加剧了投资者对经济升温和关税迫在眉睫可能使美联储陷入困境的担忧，削弱了降息的希望，甚至增加了加息的威胁。【原文：Surprisingly strong U.S. inflation in January stoked investor fears that a heating economy and looming tariffs could corner the Federal Reserve, undercutting interest rate-cut hopes and even raising the threat of a hike.】

item.title: 印度航空公司首席执行官表示暂时不会订购更多波音飞机
item.description: 印度航空公司[RIC:RIC:AIRID.UL]首席执行官坎贝尔-威尔逊（Campbell Wilson）周三告诉路透社，该公司将暂缓执行购买更多波音喷气机的未决期权，直到飞机制造商清理完积压的订单。【原文：Air India [RIC:RIC:AIRID.UL] is holding off on exercising its outstanding options to buy additional Boeing jets, its Chief Executive Campbell Wilson told Reuters on Wednesday, until the planemaker has cleared its backlog.】

item.title: 加拿大银行：美国贸易战旷日持久将长期打击国内生产总值水平
item.description: 作者：Promit Mukherjee 和 David Ljunggren【原文：By Promit Mukherjee and David Ljunggren】

item.title: 分析师称，加州 10 亿美元的洛杉矶野火账单凸显了保险公司的困境
item.description: 分析师说，加州向私营保险公司征收 10 亿美元，以帮助支付其州立项目中的野火索赔，这使人们再次关注该行业在已经迅速失去吸引力的市场中所面临的挑战。【原文：California's levy of $1 billion on private insurers to help pay out wildfire claims in its state-run program has renewed focus on the challenges the industry faces in a market already losing appeal rapidly, analysts said.】

item.title: 美联储博斯蒂克：在通胀和其他政策更加明朗之前不宜再次降息
item.description: 亚特兰大联储主席拉斐尔-博斯蒂克（Raphael Bostic）周三表示，鉴于通胀路径的不确定性以及特朗普政府可能对关税和其他政策做出的调整范围，目前尚不清楚美联储何时能够再次降息。【原文：Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said on Wednesday it is not clear when the Fed can cut interest rates again given uncertainty around the path of inflation and the scope of possible changes to tariff and other policies coming from the Trump administration.】

item.title: 美联储鲍威尔称央行仍可获取所需数据
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）周三表示，央行并没有被切断其工作所需的任何数据。【原文：Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said Wednesday the central bank has not been cut off from any data it needs to do its work.】
